meanings.definition: A person who uses satire to criticize or mock others.
meanings.sent1: The satirizers in the play made everyone laugh with their clever jokes.
meanings.sent2: The satirizers at the comedy club had the audience in stitches with their witty remarks.
meanings.sent3: The satirizers at the party had everyone chuckling at their humorous skits.
meanings.sent4: The satirizers in the school newspaper were like jesters poking fun at serious topics.
meanings.sent5: The satirizers in the movie were so funny that people couldn't stop talking about them.

meanings.definition: The act of using satire to criticize or mock others.
meanings.sent1: The satirizers of the show cleverly highlighted societal issues through humor.
meanings.sent2: Political satirizers often use comedy to shed light on important topics.
meanings.sent3: The satirizers of the radio program had listeners giggling at their witty commentary.
meanings.sent4: The satirizers of the magazine painted a humorous picture of current events.
meanings.sent5: The satirizers of the play used sarcasm to make the audience think about social norms.
